message:
Polling stations ablaze across Bangladesh on eve of poll.

The opposition Bangladeshi National Party (BNP) has called a 48-hour strike from Saturday morning and has called on voters not to take part in what it is saying is a “farcical” election.

“I call upon our countrymen to fully boycott the disgraceful farce in the name of the election of January 5,” said BNP leader Begum Khaleda Zia. Zia says she has been under virtual house arrest, but the government denies that.
